main event: A bright light object was observed hovering steadily over Hallett Station, Antarctica, for 15-20 minutes before ascending vertically at high speed and disappearing.
interesting points: The object was approximately 60 feet in diameter and spherical in shape., It emitted a pulsating blue-white light and made a loud humming noise., The sighting was corroborated by a three-man crew at the station and reported to the National Science Foundation., Other similar unusual phenomena were observed around the same time at Hallett Station., The crew remained visibly nervous after the incident.
witness description: Chief Scientist Charles P. Smith, Chief Radio Operator Richard R. Harris, Cook/General Assistant John O. Greene
